author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
“Come, wear, and feel the coolness of khadi apparels in summer, its warm properties in winter and also help the rural artisans get a continuous employment through purchase of khadi products.”

With this message, the Khadi and Village Industries Commission (KVIC) and Tamil Nadu Sarvodaya Sangh joined hands with NIFT-TEA College of Knitwear Fashion to organise a fashion show here to display the products made by Sarvodaya Sangh members across the State and thereby, ensure more youngsters opt for khadi garments.

Exhibition

The event was conducted on the sidelines of the ongoing State-level exhibition of khadi and village industries products organised by KVIC and Tamil Nadu Sarvodaya Sangh here.

The displays of 36 garments made by Sarvodaya Sangh members on which value-addition was given by the Apparel Fashion Design course students of NIFT-TEA Institute, were made under three different themes.

“The garments have been prioritised as ‘Contemporary fashion,’ ‘Traditions of India,’ and ‘History of India,” said Arundhati Ghoshal, head of the Apparel Fashion Design department at NIFT-TEA Institute.

Style

Draping styles for different set of garments were conceptualised by the students themselves who also appeared as models.

S.A. Aramvalarthan, Assistant Development Officer of KVIC, added that all the khadi cotton, khadi silk and poly vasthra (blend of cotton and polyester) garments displayed were made by hand spinning and hand woven.
title: A fashion statement in khadi
